item.title: NCP to field candidates in all 300 seats: Nahid
item.description: The National Citizen Party (NCP) will contest the upcoming national election with the ‘Shapla Kali’ symbol and plans to field candidates in all 300 constituencies, said its convener Nahid Islam. In a video message to the nation on Tuesday night, Nahid said the party expects to finalise

item.title: No application for voter relocation to be accepted after Nov 10
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) will not accept any application for the relocation of voting addresses after November 10, ahead of the 13th parliamentary election slated for early February 2026. The EC announced the deadline for voter transfer applications based on changes in residence in a circular

item.title: EU urges inclusion of Airbus in Biman's fleet plan
item.description: The European Union (EU) today urged Bangladesh to ensure transparency and fair competition in major procurement decisions, particularly regarding the inclusion of Airbus in Biman Bangladesh Airlines' fleet renewal plans, to maintain a level playing field for European companies. "In this regard, I

item.title: Tthree motorcyclists killed in Bagerhat road accident
item.description: Three motorcyclists were killed in a bus and truck collision at Belai Bridge on the Khulna-Mongla highway in Rampal upazila of Bagerhat on Tuesday. The deceased were identified as Jamir Ijaddar, 50, Mizan Bepari, 45 and Haripada Roy, 40, all residents of Rajnagar Union under Rampal upazila, report

item.title: Jamaat for referendum in Nov, election in Feb
item.description: Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami on Tuesday called on the interim government to hold the referendum on the July Charter within November and to ensure parliamentary elections in February next year. The demand was made at a meeting of the party's Central Executive Council chaired by Ameer Dr. Shafiq

item.title: Vatican minister calls Rohingya plight 'a real shame'
item.description: Visiting Vatican Minister Cardinal Michael Felix Czerny has described the prolonged suffering of the Rohingya people as "a real shame," expressing deep concern over the international community's failure to find a lasting solution to their crisis. "The situation for the Rohingya in Cox's Bazar is v

item.title: Bangladesh firms ink $1b soybean deal with US
item.description:
In a major boost to bilateral trade, a consortium of Bangladesh's top soy crushing companies, Meghna Group, City Group, and Delta Agro, has committed to purchasing $1 billion worth of U.S. soybeans over the next twelve months.
The landmark agreement with the U.S. Soybean Export Council (USSEC),

item.title: BRUCSU polls: Six-member election commission formed
item.description: A six-member Election Commission has been formed for organizing the Begum Rokeya University Central Students' Union (BRUCSU) and Hall Students' Union (HTU) elections for the first time since establishment of the university. This decision was finalized at the 116th syndicate meeting held in t
